questions.question:
Which of the following is a scalar quantity?
A. Force
B. Velocity
C. Acceleration
D. Distance

What is the SI unit of electric current?
A. Ampere
B. Volt
C. Ohm
D. Watt

Which of the following is a fundamental force of nature?
A. Gravity
B. Friction
C. Tension
D. Magnetism

Which law states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction?
A. Newton's First Law
B. Newton's Second Law
C. Newton's Third Law
D. Coulomb's Law

What is the speed of light in a vacuum?
A. 300,000 km/s
B. 30,000 km/s
C. 3,000 km/s
D. 300 km/s

What is the SI unit of force?
A. Kilogram
B. Newton
C. Watt
D. Joule

Which of the following is an example of a vector quantity?
A. Mass
B. Temperature
C. Time
D. Displacement

What does the acronym 'AC' stand for in AC current?
A. Alternating Current
B. Analog Current
C. Ampere Current
D. Accelerated Current

What is the unit of measurement for resistance?
A. Ampere
B. Ohm
C. Volt
D. Watt

Which scientist proposed the theory of general relativity?
A. Isaac Newton
B. Albert Einstein
C. Galileo Galilei
D. Niels Bohr

What is the formula for calculating work?
A. W = mgh
B. W = Fd
C. W = Pt
D. W = qV

Which of the following is a unit of power?
A. Newton
B. Joule
C. Pascal
D. Watt

What is the law of conservation of energy?
A. Energy cannot be created or destroyed
B. Energy always decreases in a system
C. Energy is always increasing in a system
D. Energy can only be created

Which of the following is an example of an insulator?
A. Copper
B. Aluminum
C. Rubber
D. Silver

What is the unit of measurement for frequency?
A. Hertz
B. Ohm
C. Ampere
D. Watt

Which of the following is a type of electromagnetic radiation?
A. Sound waves
B. X-rays
C. Water waves
D. Seismic waves

What is the formula to calculate speed?
A. s = vt
B. s = at^2
C. s = gt^2
D. s = 1/2at^2

What is the SI unit of power?
A. Newton
B. Watt
C. Volt
D. Ampere

Which of the following is an example of a contact force?
A. Gravity
B. Friction
C. Magnetic force
D. Electrostatic force

What is the formula to calculate pressure?
A. P = F/A
B. P = mv
C. P = W/t
D. P = qV

What is the acceleration due to gravity on Earth?
A. 10 m/s
B. 9.8 m/s
C. 9.8 km/s
D. 9.8 cm/s

Which of the following is a type of energy?
A. Ampere
B. Ohm
C. Volt
D. Kinetic

What is the unit of measurement for electric charge?
A. Ampere
B. Coulomb
C. Ohm
D. Volt

Which law states that the current flowing through a conductor is directly proportional to the voltage applied across it?
A. Ohm's Law
B. Newton's Law
C. Pascal's Law
D. Coulomb's Law

What is the formula for calculating density?
A. D = mv
B. D = F/A
C. D = W/t
D. D = qV

Which of the following is an example of a balanced force?
A. Pushing a car uphill
B. Jumping off a diving board
C. Lifting a heavy box
D. Sitting in a chair

What is the unit of measurement for voltage?
A. Ampere
B. Ohm
C. Volt
D. Watt

Which of the following is an example of a non-renewable energy source?
A. Solar power
B. Wind power
C. Natural gas
D. Hydroelectric power

What is the law of conservation of momentum?
A. Momentum cannot be created or destroyed
B. Momentum always increases in a system
C. Momentum is always decreasing in a system
D. Momentum can only be created

Which scientist is credited with discovering the laws of planetary motion?
A. Isaac Newton
B. Albert Einstein
C. Galileo Galilei
D. Johannes Kepler

What is the formula to calculate power?
A. P = F/A
B. P = W/t
C. P = mv
D. P = qV

Which of the following is a unit of electric potential?
A. Ampere
B. Volt
C. Ohm
D. Watt

What is the formula to calculate momentum?
A. p = mv
B. p = F/A
C. p = W/t
D. p = qV

What is the force experienced by a charged particle moving through a magnetic field?
A. Electric force
B. Gravitational force
C. Tension force
D. Magnetic force

Which of the following is an example of a centripetal force?
A. Friction
B. Gravity
C. Tension
D. Electric force

What is the unit of measurement for frequency?
A. Hertz
B. Ohm
C. Ampere
D. Watt

Which law states that the potential difference across a conductor is directly proportional to the current flowing through it?
A. Ohm's Law
B. Newton's Law
C. Pascal's Law
D. Coulomb's Law

What is the formula for calculating work done by a force?
A. W = Fd
B. W = Pt
C. W = qV
D. W = mgh

Which of the following is a unit of pressure?
A. Pascal
B. Newton
C. Joule
D. Watt

What is the law of universal gravitation?
A. Every object in the universe attracts every other object with a force
B. Objects at rest will stay at rest unless acted upon by an external force
C. For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction
D. The force exerted by a fluid is directly proportional to the depth of the fluid

Which of the following is an example of an elastic collision?
A. Dropping a ball and letting it bounce
B. Pushing a box across a floor
C. Stirring a cup of coffee
D. Hitting a nail with a hammer

What is the SI unit of temperature?
A. Kelvin
B. Celsius
C. Fahrenheit
D. Joule

Which of the following is an example of a renewable energy source?
A. Coal
B. Oil
C. Natural gas
D. Solar power

What is the formula to calculate electric power?
A. P = F/A
B. P = mv
C. P = W/t
D. P = qV

Which of the following is a unit of electrical resistance?
A. Ampere
B. Ohm
C. Volt
D. Watt

What is the formula for calculating force?
A. F = ma
B. F = Pt
C. F = qV
D. F = W/t

Which of the following is an example of a balanced torque?
A. A wrench turning a bolt
B. A see-saw balanced at the midpoint
C. A car accelerating on a straight road
D. A pendulum swinging back and forth

What is the unit of measurement for time?
A. Second
B. Minute
C. Hour
D. Day

Which law states that the current flowing through a circuit is directly proportional to the voltage and inversely proportional to the resistance?
A. Ohm's Law
B. Newton's Law
C. Pascal's Law
D. Coulomb's Law

What is the formula to calculate electrical resistance?
A. R = V/I
B. R = Pt
C. R = W/t
D. R = qV

Which of the following is an example of a non-conservative force?
A. Gravity
B. Friction
C. Tension
D. Normal force

What is the formula for calculating gravitational potential energy?
A. PE = mgh
B. PE = Fd
C. PE = Pt
D. PE = qV

Which of the following is a unit of electrical current?
A. Ampere
B. Volt
C. Ohm
D. Watt

What is the force experienced by a charged particle due to an electric field?
A. Electric force
B. Gravitational force
C. Tension force
D. Magnetic force

Which of the following is an example of a non-contact force?
A. Gravity
B. Friction
C. Tension
D. Magnetic force

What is the formula to calculate acceleration?
A. a = Δv/Δt
B. a = F/m
C. a = W/t
D. a = qV

What is the unit of measurement for distance?
A. Meter
B. Kilogram
C. Second
D. Joule

Which law states that the pressure exerted by a fluid is directly proportional to the depth of the fluid?
A. Pascal's Law
B. Newton's Law
C. Ohm's Law
D. Coulomb's Law

What is the formula for calculating electric potential energy?
A. PE = qV
B. PE = Fd
C. PE = Pt
D. PE = mgh

Which of the following is an example of a conservative force?
A. Friction
B. Gravity
C. Tension
D. Normal force

What is the unit of measurement for acceleration?
A. m/s²
B. m/s
C. m²/s
D. m²/s²

Which of the following is an example of a mechanical wave?
A. Radio waves
B. X-rays
C. Light waves
D. Sound waves

What is the formula to calculate electric current?
A. I = Q/t
B. I = Pt
C. I = W/t
D. I = F/A

What is the force experienced by a mass due to gravity?
A. Electric force
B. Gravitational force
C. Tension force
D. Magnetic force

B. Pushing a car uphill
C. Lifting a heavy box
D. Sitting in a chair

What is the unit of measurement for work?
A. Joule
B. Newton
C. Pascal
D. Watt

Which law states that the acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force applied to it and inversely proportional to its mass?
A. Newton's First Law
B. Newton's Second Law
C. Newton's Third Law
D. Coulomb's Law

What is the formula for calculating electric charge?
A. Q = It
B. Q = Pt
C. Q = W/t
D. Q = F/A

B. Displacement
C. Acceleration
D. Temperature

C. Watt
D. Ampere

D. A book on a shelf

What is the unit of measurement for power?
A. Watt

D. Pascal
